content: 1 kvetching by brenda dayne & jeny staiman 2 road trip knits about size kvetching mitts are a pattern mash-up of two great one size - 7 1⁄2 to 8 inch circumference around the knitty com designs by two wonderful designers widest part of the hand excluding the thumb fetching by cheryl niamath and knucks by pam gauge grossman both of these patterns debuted in knitty in the summer of 2006 like fetching kvetching approximately 20 sts/28 row = 4 inches/10cm in features an elegant cabled cuff a ribbed hand and a stockinette gauge is flexible sweet cabled detail at the fingertips like knucks the materials mitts are worked from fingers to cuff and feature a about 90-120 m 100-130 yd worsted weight yarn provisionally cast on thumb gusset grey mitts - madeline tosh vintage el greco to complete the design we hid a purl column inside pink mitts - malabrigo rios english rose the cables at the fingertips and wrist to help control flare and we devised a foolproof method for closing tools holes at the sides of the thumb gusset like their one set of needles for working in the round inspirations kvetching mitts are quick to knit make size us 5/3 75 or us 6/4mm great gifts and provide an excellent introduction to darning needle working simple cables and provisional stitches stitch markers 3 kvetching techniques directions cables upper hand 2/2 right cross - slip 2 sts to cable needle cn and cast on 44 sts hold in back k2 k2 from cn rounds start on the little finger side of the mitt 2/2 left cross - slip 2 sts to cn and hold in front k2 rnds 1-6 k1 p1 k2 p1 8 times k1 p1 twice k2 from cn » next round is the first cable cross as you work each cross notes the purl stitch inside each cable changes to a knit stitch there are two standard rounds that will be referenced note that the crosses on opposing sides are mirrored frequently in the instructions that follow round 7 cable cross round cable cross 2/2 right cross p1 4 times k1 p1 round 8 body rib round 2/2 left cross p1 4 times k1 p1 repeat body rib until mitt reaches the lowest point of body rib k4 p1 4 times k1 p1 twice the crook between index finger and thumb although cable crosses throughout the mitt appear to thumb & gusset setup be identical the number of rounds between crosses actually varies based on position in the garment round 1 k4 p1 3 times k3 place the next 5 sts k p k p top cable cast on 6 rounds then cross k on a holder or bind off with scrap yarn cast on 15 sts top two wrist cables cross then 5 rounds provisionally see appendix then rejoin and complete bottom wrist cable cross then 4 rounds bind off the round k3 p1 k4 p1 3 times k1 p1 54 sts 4
